abstract: A case involving JPMorgan is another example of the drumbeat of disconcerting revelations about banks.
snippet: A case involving JPMorgan is another example of the drumbeat of disconcerting revelations about banks.
lead_paragraph: Is it a blinding statement of the obvious to say that trust in the world’s banks has suffered lately? Indeed, just when you think you’re ready to move past the steady drumbeat of disconcerting revelations, something else crops up to test your faith, Gretchen Morgenson writes in her latest Fair Game column in The New York Times.
